definition: essence/extract/vitality/energy/semen/sperm/mythical goblin spirit/highly perfected/elite/the pick of sth/proficient (refined ability)/extremely (fine)/selected rice (archaic)
to support/to sustain/to erect/to raise/branch/division/to draw money/classifier for rods such as pens and guns, for army divisions and for songs or compositions

sentences.english: In very long a time, he has become my only spiritual prop.
sentences.chinese: 在很长的一段时间里他成为了我唯一的精神支柱。
第十一，培养宗教信仰和精神支柱。

sentences.english: Religion is a massively powerful fortifier to those suffering oppression and injustice.
sentences.chinese: 宗教是那些遭受压迫和不公的人的强有力精神支柱。

sentences.english: Yasukuni Shrine is the spiritual pillar of Japanese militarist aggression and expansion.
sentences.chinese: 靖国神社是日本军国主义对外侵略扩张的精神支柱。

sentences.english: Foster common ideals and aspirations throughout society.
sentences.chinese: 在社会形成共同理想和精神支柱。

sentences.english: Her pledge to remain faithful to him was his anchor when he was in prison.
sentences.chinese: 她对他忠贞不渝的保证是他服刑时代的精神支柱。

sentences.english: This monument has become a landmark and spiritual support of this city.
sentences.chinese: 这个纪念碑成为城市的标志和精神支柱。

sentences.english: But you probably cannot call such a relationship spiritual support.
sentences.chinese: 但是这种关系也不能说这是精神支柱的一种东西。

sentences.english: Yasuguni Shrine has become a spiritual pillar of Japanese militarists' policy of aggression and expansion.
sentences.chinese: 靖国神社是日本军国主义对外侵略扩张的精神支柱。

definition: spiritual leader (of a nation or church)/religious leader
lit. lone army putting up a brave fight (idiom)/fig. (of a person or group of people) struggling hard without support
one who is cut off from others (idiom)/one who has chosen to follow a solitary path/(can also be an indirect way of referring to an unmarried person)
to cause sth to collapse under the weight/(fig.) to overwhelm
to entrust (to sb)/to place (one's hope, energy etc) in/a thing in which you invest (your hope, energy etc)
